title: Revert is slower than close and reopen in Java Editor
description:
When performing the following steps: 
1. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog 
2. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it 

The file is closed and reopened quickly. However, when repeating steps 1 and 2, and then selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
OB: When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original file.
EB: Reverting the file contents should not take longer than simply closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the Java editor
2. Make changes to the file
3. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog
4. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it
5. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor

Expected: The file contents are reverted quickly
Actual: It takes approximately 15 seconds to revert the file contents
